snippet: A pick by President Obama or Hillary Clinton would put Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. in the minority in many close cases, or even nudge him to the left....
abstract: Outcome of presidential election and subsequent appointment of justice to replace late Justice Anton Scalia will offer conservative Supreme Court Chief Justice John G Roberts Jr new chance to define his role and position in court; conservative appointment by Donald Trump would give Roberts chance to lead more assertively, while liberal appointment by Hillary Clinton would offer choice of moving to center or becoming minority figure.
lead_paragraph: A pick by President Obama or Hillary Clinton would put Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. in the minority in many close cases, or even nudge him to the left.

headline.main: Court Leader or Leading Dissenter? Chief Justice’s Fate Tied to Election
headline.print_headline: Leader or Dissenter? Election May Alter Chief Justice’s Role
